TopicTitle: BobCat Ind. - Colonization, exploring and research vehicle

Articles.Content: It's the new HOME, but the title isn't.

It's the new HOME, but the title isn't.

I have found everything that was presented in the video and the indescribably happy!

Edited October 11, 2013 by khagar
There a bug with Powerplant part. It has no fuel to work, although it is in the file, and after the launch it disappears from the list of items.

There a bug with Powerplant part. It has no fuel to work, although it is in the file, and after the launch it disappears from the list of items.

I just had this problem exactly.
how do i use the fuel converter on home2?

how do i use the fuel converter on home2?

The energy + air intake

The energy + air intake

Can you take a screenshot?

Can you take a screenshot?

That. But it takes a lot of energy. Not the most economical, but a pretty good way to fuel production on other planets.

Edited October 13, 2013 by khagar
wait what HOME 2 is out?
he needs to make a proper intake that fits well with home 2 than us needing to use the home 1 one
That's what I thought you were referring to. Ha, I've been looking for a part that doesn't exist yet.

wait what HOME 2 is out?

Has been on spaceport along with HOME firstGen for going on 2 months now =P
I noticed that the air lock unfortunately does not work as a docking port. Am I doing something wrong? Or is it just for beauty?
Awesome! Were you inspired by the old Soviet plans about nuclear train on Mars (true story) by any chance?

So... A very long trailer? Doesnt seem that much has happened.. Whats new?

Very Impressive so far, I like the new R.A.T.
ooo can't wait for that to be done, once I am done with the science in carrer mode, its back to the sandbox with all the mods i don't have installed, mainly all the good ones.

Deployed mun train. Khetan driller base.

Crew , detect and equipment rover

Energy unit

Khetane extraction unit

Would be nice to see you do a complete set along with a interplanetary ship all with the same theme.

Any chance of putting these up so we can have a mess about and give some input?

Also a Tanker trailer would be nice, I don't know if its possible to have it use modular fuel system so you can decide what fuel it carries over a trailer with tanks on it.

Would be nice to see these have their own sleek and sexy animated retractable parts for drilling etc.

Also perhaps widening the wheelbase for stability and making a flat bed for a KAS crane.

Caterpillar tracks maybe?

Edited October 23, 2013 by Hawkstorm
looking good bobcat.

Hmm

Personally I don't see the reason to decouple the trailers if your mining other than a excuse to use KAS if you understand what I mean, the legs and the solar panels sticking out kinda spoils the look of things for me, perhaps make a RTG Generator trailer to perform that function or have the command sections rear perform that function.

Overall I think the model could use some upscaling width wise to give a larger and wider wheelbase.

As far as the landing legs go you could remove them entirely with caterpillar tracks, whereby the tracks are in a triangle and they rotate on the center axis so the tracks themselves lift the vehical and the brakes stop the vehical moving, as well as looking a lot better it would also be damn cool.

Wheels are so yesterday! ROFL

As far as a RAT pod to deploy the sections it needs to be able to be opened and shut in the VAB/SPH I think like the B9 does something similar I think, assembly is a rip your hair out affair otherwise.

Other than that looking good.

Edited October 26, 2013 by Hawkstorm
So will the GenII DEMVs come with their own wheel sets to use as well as being able to use the vanilla/other third party ones?

I am using Bobcats vehicles and H.O.M.E in my Duna colony. The Hub tube dock fine as can be seen here with 6 H.O.M.E bases interconnected and docked as one unit. Kethane drilling unit fills the blue&orange fuel tanks via KAS connected pipes

Edited October 26, 2013 by Azazael

Personally I don't see the reason to decouple the trailers if your mining other than a excuse to use KAS if you understand what I mean, the legs and the solar panels sticking out kinda spoils the look of things for me, perhaps make a RTG Generator trailer to perform that function or have the command sections rear perform that function.

Or that by decoupling/undocking them you can deploy the trailers and then use the front command trailer to go back to the main base and get more trailers to deploy, levelling a long trailer for drilling is much more difficult than a short one, it's how you'd do it in real life, there's multiple reasons. Don't knock his example just because you can't think of a reason.

Overall I think the model could use some upscaling width wise to give a larger and wider wheelbase.

And how do you propose to get it to wherever? A matter transporter?

As far as the landing legs go you could remove them entirely with caterpillar tracks, whereby the tracks are in a triangle and they rotate on the center axis so the tracks themselves lift the vehical and the brakes stop the vehical moving, as well as looking a lot better it would also be damn cool.

Still doesn't solve levelling the sections once you get them in position. Also tracks are heavy and complex, that makes them a liability when you're tens of thousands of kilometers from home. There's a good reason there's never been a tracked vehicle in space.

Edited October 29, 2013 by CAPFlyer
